Since the time to travel between cylinders is negligible, the electron travels from the plate to cylinder 1 in less than the time it takes for the AC voltage to change polarity.
The velocity v_1 of the electron when it enters cylinder 1 can be found using the kinematic equation v_1 = a T = eU/md T.

The electric field alternates every half-period T/2.
The length L_n of the n-th cylinder must be L_n = v_1 * T/2.
